info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 12:38AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
At 1238 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 13 miles northwest of New Buffalo, or 17 miles north of Michigan City, moving northeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Benton Harbor, St. Joseph, Fair Plain, Benton Heights, Bridgman, Berrien Springs, Watervliet, Coloma, Stevensville, Shorewood-Tower Hill, Paw Paw Lake, Lake Michigan Beach, Shorewood-Tower Hills-Harbert, Sodus, Riverside, Baroda, Shoreham, Eau Claire, Spinks Corners, and Millburg.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 196 between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 94 in Michigan between mile markers 13 and 42.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
